column4: Mind anyone help me? I have an Abit IP35-E running with a Marvell 88E8056, and Hardy won't recognize ethernet. It shows on lspci. Other than Keyboard/Mouse/Screen, I can't transfer anything. What do I do?
: did you tried interminal pppoeconf to see if it is recognized
Hmm.. I'll try.
Well, it did recognize it there, and apparently ifconfig shows it too, but it just has no IP. I'll check /etc/network/interfaces
: so you need to configure it
: wired or wireless
Right, I configured it now and doing /etc/init.d/networking restart. Apparently it doesn't seem to discover my router while configured via DHCP
and it complains about /etc/resolv.conf being missing
: network>DNS tab> put  yur nameservers there>
Alright.
: if you use router don´t delete first line jujst add one or two more
Well, I added the nameservers, but It still isn't able to get an IP via DHCP. I tried doing static too, but then I can't even ping my router.
On the DHCP process it says DHCPDISCOVER on eth0 to 255.255.255.255 port 67 interval <something>.
I think it was 255.255.255.0 last time I checked
Well, Should be.

: network applet>manual config>select your modem (don´t check it just click on it)>properties>select your type of connection>DNS tab>put nameservers there>connection tab>check your modem now and you should see message changing iterfaces now
Done, it showed that "Changing Interface Configuration" message, it went away, and it still didn't get an IP.
: pppoeconf now to get resolve conf  that is all I can think of
All pppoeconf does is some scanning and tells me that I don't have a "PPPoE consertum" or something like that.
: gedit /etc/resolv.conf  and see if you have any nameserver there
Yeah, I have the OpenDNS nameservers I set there and 192.168.1.1 (My router) Which I just added to see if changes anything, and it doesn't.
: sorry I´m runing out of ideas try with somebody smarter then me
Aight. Thanks for trying to help :)
: sorry I didn´n make it work for you
